channel.title: Local Obituaries from WAOW.com and Tributes.com
channel.description: Obituaries and Online Obituaries News at Tributes.com. Find Local and National Obituaries News and Personal Tributes. Read Obituaries, Death and Funeral Notices, and Create Obituaries for Loved Ones.

item.title: Viola Wendt-Schmidt, 88, Merrill, Wisconsin
item.description: Viola C. Wendt-Schmidt, age 88, of Merrill, passed away Monday, March 4, 2013 at Artisan Assisted Living formerly known as Walnut Grove Assisted Living. She was born November 17, 1924 in Merrill to the late Carl & Paulina (Braun) Schulz. She married Raymond Wendt in Merrill on November 16, 1946. He preceded her in death October 7, 1978. She later married Wilbert Schmidt in Wausau. He also preceded her in death. Viola was the youngest of 12 children. She grew up on the family farm in the town...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Alberta Montabon, 82, Gleason, Wisconsin
item.description: Alberta "Sue" Montabon, 82, of Gleason, died Thursday, February 28, 2013 at Woodland Court under the care of Aspirus Comfort Care & Hospice Services. She was born November 23, 1930 to the late Albert & Marie (Tejacik) Oldenburg in Antigo. On May 16, 1960 she and Kermit Montabon were united in marriage. Sue was a 1949 graduate of Antigo High School. She later attended business school in Milwaukee where she earned a degree in accounting. Sue then worked for Consolidated Foods in Milwaukee....
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Betty M. Vilski, 88, Hawkins, Wisconsin
item.description:
Betty passed away on Sunday, March 10, 2013.
Betty was a resident of Hawkins, Wisconsin.
Funeral services will be held at 11:00 AM on Friday, March 15, 2013 at St. Mary's Catholic Church in Hawkins. Burial will be in Hillcrest Cemetery in Hawkins. Betty's family will receive friends from 4:00 to 7:00 PM on Thursday, March 14 at the Nash-Jackan Funeral Home in Ladysmith and again on Friday for an hour prior to service time at the church.
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Doris C. Tank, 96, Weyauwega, Wisconsin
item.description:
Doris was born on September 27, 1916 and passed away on Sunday, March 10, 2013.
Doris was a resident of Weyauwega, Wisconsin at the time of her passing.
She was preceded in death by her husband Vernon.
The Christian Funeral for Doris will be held on Wednesday, March 13, 2013, at 11:00 a.m. at St. Peter Ev. Lutheran Church, Weyauwega, with Rev. Dennis Lemke and Rev. Newlin Schafer officiating. Burial will be in Little Wolf Cemetery, Town of Little Wolf. A visitation for Doris will be...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Rosalyn Boser, 93, Marathon, Wisconsin
item.description: Rosalyn Boser, age 93, passed away peacefully on Saturday, March 9, 2013 under the wonderful care of Aspirus Comfort Care and Hospice Services. She was greeted by an angel, Katie Hart, who was her best friend and niece. She was born March 12, 1919, in the town of Frankfort, daughter of the late George and Catherine (Kipp) Ellenbecker. On June 13, 1939 she married Joseph Boser at St. John Catholic Church, Wuertzburg. He survives. After retiring from Marathon Cheese, Rosalyn enjoyed...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.description:

In lieu of flowers, memorial donations may be made to American Legion Post 89 in his...

item.title: Barney J. Firkus, Sr., 77, Almond, Wisconsin
item.description:
Barney was born on April 16, 1935 and passed away on Friday, March 8, 2013.
Barney was a resident of Almond, Wisconsin at the time of his passing.

Visitation will be held from 10:00 amuntil time of service at the church. Father Hector Moreno will officiate. Burial will be held at St. Patrick's Cemetery...

item.title: Roger Butch Neuman, 79, Shawano, Wisconsin
item.description: Roger C. 'Butch' Neuman 1933-2013 Roger Neuman, 79, passed away on March 7, 2013. He was born on December 10, 1933 in Tigerton, WI to Ernest and Viola (Gayhart) Neuman. After spending some time growing up on the family farm in Tigerton, the family moved to Shawano where Roger was confirmed at St. James Lutheran Grade School. He graduated from Shawano High School after spending nearly a year in Theda Clark Hospital due to complications from Guillian-Barre Syndrome. In 1960, Roger...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Wanda Ashdown, 93, Wausau, Wisconsin
item.description: Wanda Ashdown, 93, Wausau, died Weds. March 6, 2013 at Mount View Care Center, Wausau. She was born May 7, 1919, in East Liverpool, Ohio, daughter of the late Allen and Cecil (Smith) Brown. On December 11, 1941, she married Alfred Ashdown in Ohio. He preceded her in death, August 25, 1984. Wanda was a homemaker and loved the time spent with her family. She enjoyed traveling and was always ready to go on any time of trip especially bus tours. Survivors include her daughter, Cindi (Tom)...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Glenn A. Sebby, 93, Lac du Flambeau, Wisconsin
item.description: Glenn A. Sebby, age 93, of Lac du Flambeau, passed away on Wednesday, March 6, 2013 at Our Home K-Care in Lac du Flambeau. He was born on August 17, 1919 in Plainfield, IL, the son of Arthur and Rose Sebby. Glenn was a proud Veteran of the United States Navy. He served in the Navy from 1943-46 during World War II, aboard the U.S.S. Enterprise. On May 16, 1996 he married Patricia Hrabik. Glenn was a member of the American Legion Post 89 of Minocqua and enjoyed hunting, fishing, music and...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Anita M. Kielblock, 85, Tigerton, Wisconsin
item.description:
Anita was born on August 16, 1927 and passed away on Wednesday, March 6, 2013.
Anita was a resident of Tigerton, Wisconsin at the time of her passing.
She was preceded in death by her husband Wallace.
Funeral Service will be held on Saturday, March 9th at 11:00 AM at St. John Lutheran Church, Tigerton. Rev. Matthew Uttenreither will officiate and burial will be in the spring at Union Cemetery, Tigerton. Friends may call on Saturday from 9:00 AM until time of service at the church. The...

item.title: Karl L. Block, 75, Wausau, Wisconsin
item.description: Karl (with a "K") was born August 4th 1937, the son of the late Norman and Hazel (Salzsieder) Block, in the town of Easton. He was raised on the family farm, learning the skills and values that shaped him into the hardworking, dedicated family man that all came to know and love. On May 14th 1966, he was united in marriage to Kay Zahrt, at St. John's Lutheran Church, in the town of Easton. They shared 46 years together and raised three children, making many memories along the way. For 31...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Thomas J. Kloehn, 78, Minocqua, Wisconsin
item.description: Thomas J. Kloehn, 78, of Minocqua passed away at UW Hospitals in Madison on Wednesday, March 6, 2013. He was born in Milwaukee, WI on March 12, 1934 to James and Edith (Hartson) Kloehn. Thomas proudly served his country in the U.S. Army. He married Shirley A. (nee Ashenbrenner) on January 7, 1956 in Gresham, WI at St. Francis Church. He retired in 1990 as an Industrial Motor Salesmen for the G.E. Co and moved to Minocqua. Tom was an active member of Rock of Ages Lutheran Church in Minocqua. He...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.title: Carol L. Giese, 80, Wausau, Wisconsin
item.description: Carol L. Giese, age 80, died Tuesday, March 5, 2013 under the care of Aspirus Comfort Care and Hospice Services at Azura Memory Care, Wausau. She was born November 29, 1932 in Wausau, daughter of the late August and Betty (Hoeft) Brandt. On January 31, 1953 she married Robert Giese in Athens. He preceded her in death. Carol farmed in the Athens area with her husband. After he became disabled she took care of him for many years, then moved to Wausau where she worked as a Certified Nursing...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.description:

item.title: Ricky A. Lecher, 51, Wausau, Wisconsin
item.description: Ricky "Bugeyes" Lecher, 51, Wausau died Monday, March 4, 2013 under the care of Comfort Care and Hospice Services at Aspirus Wausau Hospital. He was born December 7, 1961 in Wisconsin Rapids, son of James and Sharon (Coon) Lecher, Wausau. On July 29, 1989 he married Susan Manowski at Trinity Lutheran Church, Wausau. She survives. For more than 25 years Ricky worked at Overhear Door Company in Wausau and later went to work at Streich Equipment. Some of his favorite pastimes included...
item.author: Tributes.com

item.description:

item.description:

At Debra's request, the family asks that memorials be made to the Shepherd of the Lakes Church Travel Mission fund in lieu of flowers.

item.title: Terri J. Mustache, 50, Lac du Flambeau, Wisconsin
item.description: Terri J. Mustache, age 50, of Lac du Flambeau, passed away on Saturday, March 2, 2013 at her home surrounded by family. She was born on January 29, 1963 in Hayward, the daughter of James and Gertrude (nee LaRush) Mustache. Terri was preceded in death by her parents. She is survived by her children, Edward Mustache, Michael Mustache, Emma Beighley, Kami Beighley, Mamie Beighley and Sadie Beighley; brothers and sisters, Edward LaRush, Alan LaRush, Elliot LaRush, Majorie Leach, Gloria Mustache,...
